headers: PRODUCTION ARCHITECTURE — HOW 41 MODELS GET BUILT

rows.PRODUCTION ARCHITECTURE — HOW 41 MODELS: The project plan for producing the Trade itself. Not the business — the document.
THE PROBLEM
41 operating models need to go from skeleton to expert-grade.
If one person does this sequentially, it takes 6+ months and they burn out.
If 41 experts each own a model, coordination overhead kills you.
If AI fills everything unsupervised, quality is mediocre across the board.
The answer is a production loop: AI generates, expert calibrates, PM manages.
THE PRODUCTION LOOP (Per Model)
Step 1: AI DRAFT — Claude fills all tabs in the model from skeleton to first draft. (~1-2 hours per model)
Input: skeleton tabs + M0 thesis + reference models + any existing content
Output: complete first draft of every tab, flagged assumptions, known gaps
Step 2: EXPERT CALIBRATION — Domain expert reviews AI draft and gives feedback. (~30-60 min per model)
Input: AI draft + list of specific questions for the expert
Output: markup (what's wrong, what's missing, what's impressive, what's embarrassing)
The expert does NOT fill tabs. They tell you what good looks like.
Step 3: AI REVISION — Claude incorporates expert feedback and produces second draft. (~1 hour per model)
Input: first draft + expert markup
Output: revised draft that addresses every piece of feedback
Step 4: PM REVIEW — PM checks revised draft against expert feedback. (~30 min per model)
Input: revised draft + original expert markup
Output: sign-off OR back to Step 3 with specific fixes
Step 5: LOCK — Model is marked complete. PM logs it in Production Tracker. (~5 min)
Criteria: expert feedback addressed, no open flags, PM signed off
Total time per model: ~3-4 hours of AI work + 30-60 min of expert time + 30-60 min of PM time
Total for 41 models: ~120-160 hours AI + ~25-40 hours expert + ~25-40 hours PM
Calendar time with one PM running 2-3 models/week: ~14-20 weeks
THE ROLES
PM (1 person, the whole time):
Owns the production schedule. Runs the loop for every model.
Prepares AI prompts. Sends expert briefs. Reviews output. Logs progress.
Does NOT need to be a domain expert in anything. Needs to be organized and relentless.
This is a 10-15 hr/week role for ~16 weeks.
AI (Claude, unlimited):
Generates first drafts. Incorporates feedback. Produces revisions.
Gets better over time as expert calibration accumulates across models.
Each completed model becomes training data for the next one.
Domain Experts (8-10 people, 2-4 hours each):
One expert covers a CLUSTER of related models, not one model each.
They review AI output and say what's wrong. They do not write anything.
Engagement: one 30-60 min call per cluster, async follow-up if needed.
Paid per session or traded for access to finished Trade.
